English: (We shall be triad to receive any items of interest from our readers for insertion in this column. Articles or notes forwarded must be brief.)

Manx: Gowee coorse jeh Lessoonyn Gaihlkagh aashagh toshiaght ayns “Yn Brialtagh” dy gerrit.
English: A course of easy Manx Lessons will begin in “The Examiner” shortly.

Manx: Manninee dooie nagh vel tushtey oc er y Ghailck — Chengey ny Mayrey oc hene lhisagh ad siyrree dy ynsaghey chengey nyn shenn ayraghyn.
English: Native Manx People without knowledge of Manx — Their own Mother Tongue, they should hasten to learn the language of their ancestors.

Manx: Ny jarrood ginsh da ny caarjyn eu nagh vel goaill y pabyr-naight Gailckagh hoshee — “Yn Brialtagh Elian Vannin.”
English: Don’t forget to tell your friends who do not get the leading Manx Gaelic newspaper — “The Isle of Man Examiner.”
